item.title: Nuclear | Moscow says it will continue to comply with the treaty if the US does so
item.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said yesterday that Moscow will continue to comply with the limits imposed on its nuclear arsenal, despite the recent end of the New START treaty, as long as the United States does the same. These restrictions “will remain in force, but only as long as the United States does not exceed the limits stipulated” in the treaty, Lavrov said in an intervention made yesterday in the Russian parliament. Moscow “will act in a responsible and considered manner, based on an analysis of US military policy (…) and an analysis of the general strategic situation”, he added. Russia and the United States have by far the largest nuclear arsenals in the world, but since the New START Treaty expired earlier this month, there is no nuclear disarmament agreement linking the two powers. The treaty, signed in 2010 between Russia and the United States, limited the number of nuclear missile launchers to intercontinental distances. It expired on February 5th, as US President Donald Trump did not respond to Moscow's proposal to extend it.

item.title: HZM Border | Concession yields 1.2 million per month
item.description: Sociedade Express Grupo Limitada will pay 1.2 million patacas monthly to the Macao SAR to operate the commercial areas of the Macau Border Post Building on the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge (HZM). The information was published yesterday in the official bulletin, where the contract was announced. The contract has a duration of five years, meaning the final amount paid to the Macao SAR should be around 72 million patacas. The deadline starts from the effective start of exploration, which can happen until May 31st. As part of the contract, the concessionaire commits to ensuring that 30 percent of the commercial space comes into operation, excluding self-service services. Furthermore, the company can change the space to expand commercial areas, but is obliged to maintain good business and hygiene conditions. If the commercial area is increased, the contract also provides for an increase in the monthly rent price, calculated according to the effective increase in space. Sociedade Express Grupo was founded in 1999 in Macau and its main activity is operating pharmacies, linked to the Wan Tung brand, with around 30 spaces in the territory. However, its activities also extend to travel agency services, and the company's portal guarantees that it is the main representative in Macau of Cebu Airlines, although it also has links with other companies such as China Eastern, China Southern, Eva Air, among others.

item.title: Ruins of S. Paulo | Restoration of bronze statues completed
item.description: The Cultural Institute (IC) announced yesterday that the second phase of the restoration and maintenance work on the bronze statues in the Ruins of St. Paul was successfully completed. As such, the archaeological site behind the façade of the Ruins of St. Paul (including the Museum of Sacred Art and Crypt, and the virtual reality exhibition at the Ruins of St. Paul) have reopened to the public. The restoration and maintenance work on the city's emblematic landmark was divided into three phases. The first phase, completed last year, focused on the statue of the Virgin Mary on the third level and the two bronze statues to the right of the second level. The second phase, which mainly involved the two bronze statues on the left of the second level and the statue of Jesus Christ on the fourth level. The next and final phase will be the restoration this year of the Dove statue, located on the upper level. The restoration team is made up of experts from the Palace Museum, international experts in metal conservation and professionals from higher education institutions in Macau. The IC said that the restoration plan took into account “factors such as typhoon season, workplace safety, peak tourist periods and major events”.

item.title: Bruno Pernadas releases album “unlike,maybe”
item.description: Guitarist and composer Bruno Pernadas, who has performed in Macau and the Greater Bay Area, releases “unlike, maybe” this week, an album with part of the songs created in collaboration with the musicians who accompany him, something he intends to do more of in the future. After “Private Reasons”, released in 2021 and which ends a trilogy, Bruno Pernadas presents “a transition album”. “I'm still not being able to achieve what I wanted, but this is a necessary step for that to happen in the future”, he stated, in an interview with the Lusa agency, regarding “unlike, maybe”, to be published this Friday. The process of creating the album served the musician to try to “detach from certain things that can be considered vices of resources and tools”, something that “is not such an immediate process”, as it is within himself. The recordings were divided between Lisbon, where the musician lives, and Porto. In the ‘invicta city’, the musicians spent a few days in the same house “and this process was collaborative”. "More has already happened [on this album], but I want that to happen, in the future, that's all. There doesn't even need to be demos. Sometimes I don't have demos, I put everything on the agenda", he stated. Other languages The collaborative process allowed Bruno Pernadas to get closer to the language that for him “is closer to jazz, an idea that was left by the trends of Sun Ra, Don Cherry, Alice Coltrane, Art Ensemble of Chicago, The Last Poets – which is not quite jazz, but it is close”. "I wanted to get closer to that language, with which I have a lot of relationship and which didn't happen on other albums. Even on my jazz album 'worst summer ever' [from 2016 and which opened the trilogy] this way of thinking like that wasn't realized. On this album ['unlike, maybe'] it already partially exists", he said. The new album features the participation of musicians Margarida Campelo, António Quintino, João Correia, Diogo Alexandre, José Soares, Teresa Costa, Jéssica Pina and Eduardo Lála. Margarida Campelo also sings, and her voice is joined by those of guests Leonor Arnaut, Lívia Nestrovski and Maya Blandy. Some are already part of the group that accompanied him in previous works, for others it was a debut. "It's like a cast. In cinema there are many directors who have a fixed cast, but sometimes another type of approach to the artistic object is needed and they form collaborations", he said. In addition to playing, Bruno Pernadas is the composer, author and producer of “unlike, maybe”, sharing only one of the lyrics with Rita Westwood. When he goes to the studio with the musicians, “things are more or less thought out”. "There are sections that I leave open for improvisations, thinking about the musicians who are going to record. I already know how people react and there are certain things that are done with that person in mind. There are other melodies and things that I do for the people that I invite to participate in certain songs", he shared. In addition to studio recordings, Bruno Pernadas also incorporates recordings made at home, during the day and without acoustic isolation, into his albums. "I always record things at home. At first I re-recorded, but then I stopped doing that, the sounds aren't bad, it's a clinical, surgical perspective of people listening to the music. It's not bad, that's how it turned out", he said.

item.title: Light Rail | Correspondence with buses later this year
item.description: Anyone who takes a public bus after leaving the Light Metro will have a discount on the fare, similar to what happens with buses. The measure will be implemented later this year. Rail transport will also have turnstiles and electronic payments This year, the Directorate of Services for Traffic Affairs (DSAT) will implement fare matching between the Light Metro and public buses, allowing you to pay a discounted ticket for the second transport between the Light Metro and the bus, or vice versa. The measure should start this year, confirmed yesterday the deputy director of DSAT, Mok Soi Tou, to the microphones of Forum Macau, on the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. The issue of correspondence was raised by a listener and the head of DSAT said that the correspondence will be carried out taking advantage of two moments. “We will take advantage of the opportunities to update access machines (turnstiles) to the Light Metro and the renewal of public bus concession contracts, to start correspondence this year”, said Mok Soi Tou. The official added that bus routes will be adjusted as more Light Rail stations are opened, and that bus stops and pedestrian facilities will be improved and provided with information on transport correspondence. Open doors The head of DSAT highlighted that since the creation of the Light Metro, bus routes have always been adapted as new stations open. The opening of the metro station at Portas do Cerco will lead to many changes to the bus routes that serve the busiest point for people in the territory. The deputy director expects that the majority of tourists entering Macau will use the Light Metro to get to Cotai. For his part, the director of the Macau Light Rail Society, Ng Keng Chung, said that the installation of turnstiles is scheduled for the third quarter of this year, allowing payment platforms to be used via QR code, similar to what happens on buses. MPay, Alipay and WeChat Pay applications will be accepted. The replacement of turnstiles will not be done all at once, and Light Metro stations will now have automatic ticket machines that accept electronic payments. DSOP director Lam Wai Hou did not rule out the possibility of the Light Metro network having more than six lines and maintained the forecast that the Eastern Line would be opened in 2029.

item.title: BNU | Profits shrink by about a quarter by 2025
item.description: The profits of the bank owned by Caixa Geral de Depósitos have been falling for two years, but remain positive. Last year, BNU managed to reduce losses related to non-performing loans Banco Nacional Ultramarino (BNU) in Macau yesterday announced a 26.3 percent drop in net profits in 2025, the second consecutive year in which the financial institution's revenues shrank. According to a statement, the bank recorded unaudited net profits of 431.2 million patacas, 153.9 million patacas less than in 2024. BNU had already recorded a 0.4 percent drop in revenue in 2024. The bank pointed out as the main reason for the drop in profits a reduction of 13.9 percent (138 million patacas) in the net financial margin, the difference between income from loans and interest paid on deposits. BNU indicated that the net financial margin shrank, “driven mainly by the evolution of interest rates”. This is after the Macau Monetary Authority approved three cuts in the main reference interest rate in 2025, the last of which was a cut of 0.25 percentage points, introduced on December 11, following in all cases the North American Federal Reserve. The reduction in net financial margin “was partially offset” by a 2.3 percent increase in commissions charged by the bank, “reflecting greater customer engagement”. Malparado weighed BNU also indicated that it suffered losses of 30 million patacas with non-performing loans and financial investments, 15.3 percent less than in 2024. “This reduction reflects prudent risk management and the stable quality of the bank's assets, supported by conservative credit practices and a robust provisioning margin maintained throughout the year”, guaranteed the institution. “BNU’s capital and liquidity position remains strong, supported by disciplined financial management and a robust risk control system”, indicated the bank. BNU is headquartered in Macau and belongs to the Caixa Geral de Depósitos Group (CGD), being, together with the Bank of China, a currency issuer in Macau. According to official data, Macau banks achieved profits of 7.34 billion patacas in 2025, almost double that recorded in the previous year (92.7 percent more). Non-performing loans fell 11.6 percent over the past year to 49.7 billion patacas. It was the first annual drop in non-performing loans since 2013. Overdue loans represented 4.9 percent of Macau banks' loans, 0.6 percentage points less than at the end of 2024. A percentage that rises to 5.6 percent in the case of credit to institutions or individuals outside the region. The European Banking Authority, the EU regulatory agency, for example, considers that banks with at least 5 percent of non-performing loans have “high exposure” to risk and must establish a strategy to resolve the problem. Even so, the percentage of overdue bank credit in Macau is far from the record of 25.3 percent reached in mid-2001, in the midst of the global economic crisis caused by the bursting of the speculative bubble of companies linked to the Internet.

item.title: Casinos | Taxes charged increase 15% in January
item.description: The gaming sector represented 85.6 percent of taxes collected in January, with a total of MOP8.2 billion. Tax revenues from the territory's main industry increased by 14.6 percent compared to January 2025, when they did not reach 7.2 billion patacas Last January, the Government recorded 9.62 billion patacas in current revenue, 14.5 percent more than in January 2025. Of total current revenue, the portion corresponding to taxes on gaming concessionaires was more than 8.2 billion patacas, which represents 85.6 percent of all current revenue, according to data published on the Finance Services Directorate's website. In comparative terms, tax revenue generated by casinos in January increased by 14.6 percent, compared to the same month in 2025, when they reached almost 7.2 billion patacas, a difference of more than 1,000 million patacas. It is recalled that according to the new gaming concessions, which came into force for a decade on January 1, 2023, the tax on casinos' gross revenues was set at 40 percent. When counting capital revenues (sale of facilities and equipment, financial assets, sale of shares and other holdings), total revenues from public coffers in January recorded almost 9.64 billion patacas. The other side Representing almost all public revenue, revenue from the gaming sector is crucial to the Macao SAR Budget. For now, the Government estimates that 2026 will end with gross revenues from the territory's casinos of around 236 billion patacas, which will give around 19.7 billion patacas per month. To achieve this goal, January has already exceeded the estimated monthly average of around 2.93 billion patacas, when the sector's gross revenues registered more than 22.63 billion patacas, 24 percent more compared to January 2025. If a positive performance during the Chinese New Year holidays is confirmed, casino gross revenues could record an annual increase of around 18 percent in the first quarter of the year. In terms of expenses, January data from the DSF reveals that personnel expenses were around 1.19 billion patacas, 0.17 percent less compared to January 2025. In relation to public expenses to pay transfers, support and allowances, around 2.8 billion patacas came out of public coffers in January, 0.35 percent more in annual terms. Overall, January ended with revenues almost doubling expenses, with the balance for last month's financial year in positive territory at almost 5 billion patacas.

item.title: One Country, Two Systems | Sam wants Macanese to tell history “well”
item.description: The Government leader indicates that the community has a role to play in the integration of Macau into Mainland China and highlighted the value of the community in connecting China and abroad The Chief Executive wants the Macanese community to work with the Government to “guarantee the good safeguard and development” of Macau and “tell well” the story of “the successful implementation of ‘One Country, Two Systems’ in China and abroad”. Sam Hou Fai's tasks for the Macanese were left during a dinner, which took place on Tuesday, with some members of the community. According to the Government's report, at the meeting Sam Fou Fai “guaranteed that he was available to work together with the Macanese community in order to guarantee the good safeguard and development of this home [Macau]”. However, the tasks don't stop there. The leader of the Executive also wants Macanese to move “proactively in the Cooperation Zone in Hengqin and the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area” and to “actively” participate in the construction of these projects. Sam Hou Fai also highlighted that the Macanese have a place in the integration of Macau within Mainland China and that the community “fully plays out its unique advantages in language, culture, gastronomy, professionalism and interconnection with the world, helping the Macao SAR to create a relevant connection ‘door’ for the country in high-quality openness to the outside world and a privileged ‘window’ for exchange and mutual learning between Chinese and Western civilizations”. Importance assured In the message left during dinner, Sam Hou Fai also pointed out that the Government will “give importance and support the Macanese community, hoping that it can enhance its uniqueness, actively participate in the integration between Macau and Hengqin and in the construction of the Greater Bay Area”. Sam Hou Fai highlighted that the “economic and social development of the Macao SAR has been stable and progressive, basically achieving the main objectives and tasks of governance, whose government action work in the first year of the Government proceeded smoothly and stably, with reforms, innovations, advances and results”. Sam also promised to execute the Government Action Lines and stated that he believes that within the scope of the planned tasks there will be “ample opportunities” for the Macanese community “to contribute significantly and achieve notable achievements”.

item.title: Security | Macao SAR rulers applaud White Paper on Hong Kong
item.description: China has released a new White Paper on national security, on Hong Kong, which is entitled “Practice of Safeguarding National Security in Hong Kong under ‘One Country, Two Systems.’ In the Macao SAR, secretaries and political leaders reacted positively, saying that the document provides guarantees of stability and is a reference for Macau Days after the conviction in Hong Kong of Jimmy Lai, a media entrepreneur who founded the now-defunct Apple Daily newspaper, China launches a new White Paper focused on the need to safeguard national security in neighboring territory. The “Practice of Safeguarding National Security in Hong Kong under ‘One Country, Two Systems'” was published by the Communication Department of China's State Council on Tuesday. According to the Xinhua news agency, this White Paper consists of five parts, detailing “the persistent struggle to safeguard national security in Hong Kong and the fundamental responsibility of the Central Government in national security matters related to Hong Kong”. Na mesma nota, é explicado que o Livro Branco “expõe as conquistas da RAEHK no cumprimento da responsabilidade constitucional de salvaguardar a segurança nacional” e ainda “a transição de Hong Kong do caos para a estabilidade e prosperidade”. “Efforts to create [a security landscape] of high standard are not forgotten in order to promote the high-quality development of the ‘One Country, Two Systems' policy”, in addition to being explained that “the Central Government applied a holistic approach to national security”. In this context, “it effectively exercised general jurisdiction over the HKSAR, in accordance with the country's Constitution and the Basic Law of the HKSAR”, and the Law on Safeguarding National Security “has been applied in the region” and has ensured “that Hong Kong is administered by patriots”. On the Macao SAR side, the government apparatus reacted positively to this White Paper, after the bill that presents a new format and composition of the Macao SAR State Security Defense Commission, created in 2018, was generally approved in the Legislative Assembly. Chan Tsz King, Secretary for Security, was one of the political figures who reacted to the document, which considers “ensuring the stable and lasting implementation” of the “One Country, Two Systems” principle. Quoted in an official note, the secretary understands that the White Paper comes to “clarify the intrinsic unity between political principles and institutional logic, causing Hong Kong society to return to normality and order to be restored”. The document, in the secretary's view, “serves as an important reference for the Macao SAR to review and improve the construction of its legal system in the context of defending the security of the State and the respective execution mechanism”. Chan Tsz King highlights that his leadership will give “great importance to ensuring security in non-traditional areas under the new situation, establishing the long-term stability of the Macao SAR as a strategic objective”. Firme como uma rocha Also according to Xinhua, the White Paper describes how Beijing “supports the HKSAR in fulfilling its constitutional responsibility to safeguard national security by effectively preventing, interrupting and punishing any activities that put national security at risk”. “The efforts” of the neighboring region to safeguard national security aim, according to the same document, to “sustain and develop” the principle created by Beijing to support Taiwan and the two special administrative regions, without forgetting the protection of “fundamental human rights, dignity and well-being of the 7.5 million residents of Hong Kong”. The White Paper released by the State Council also states that “in today's world, and with unprecedented global transformations that have occurred in a century, they are accelerating, with the development environment facing China undergoing profound and complex changes”. In this way, “safeguarding national security is a long-term and permanent task”, it is said. The White Paper states that Hong Kong “enjoys a high standard of security”, with the region “fated to overcome all risks and challenges in the future journey, remaining as stable as a rock in a turbulent world”. Another political figure from the Macao SAR who reacted was Adriano Marques Ho, director-general of the Customs Service, saying that the White Paper “has an important guiding significance and a profound impact for the complete and accurate implementation of ‘One Country, Two Systems’ in the Hong Kong and Macau regions, for the realization of long-term prosperity and stability, and for their stable and sustainable progression”. Adriano Marques Ho added that “both Hong Kong and Macau are inalienable and sacred parts of China”, and Beijing “has firmly and consistently maintained national sovereignty, security and development interests”. In the view of the top Customs official, “the external hostile forces and anti-China elements disturbing Hong Kong incited and created the ‘legislative review riots’, which ended up evolving into a ‘color revolution’ version of Hong Kong, seriously damaging the constitutional order and the rule of law in Hong Kong, and putting national sovereignty, security and development interests at risk”. End of the “chaotic situation” Lam, Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, said the White Paper “comprehensively analyzes and outlines Hong Kong's journey in defending national security, major achievements and experience gained”. In the government's view, “Hong Kong went from a chaotic situation to stability and prosperity”. In the case of Macau, the principles contained in the White Paper apply, with the secretary promising to “continue to intensify education, giving priority to the formation of a social base that supports the values ​​of love for the country and for Macau”. In this context, the aim is to “develop a comprehensive educational system to increase the patriotic feeling of young people and consolidate the ideological foundation of national security through multidimensional educational activities and exchanges”. It is promised that the Social Affairs and Culture department “will continue to promote national security using culture as a driving force, reinforcing the exploration and dissemination of Macau’s historical and cultural resources and organizing different types of exhibitions and cultural shows with unique characteristics”. The idea is to “spread the excellent Chinese cultural heritage in order to resist the erosion of harmful cultures, reinforce the cultural and national identity of the population and unite the forces of different sectors of society through culture”. Wong Sio Chak, Secretary for Administration and Justice, who for years held the Security portfolio, considers that the White Paper has “extreme relevance for Macao SAR issues relating to the defense of national security”, particularly with regard to “defending sovereignty, security and the development interests of the State”. The promises are that the area of ​​Administration and Justice “will boost legislative production in the priority areas related to the defense of State security, continuing to improve the respective legal regime”, with “training courses on the Constitution, the Basic Law and legislation relating to the defense of State security aimed at public service workers at different levels”. In turn, Tai Kin Ip, Secretary for Economy and Finance, described that “economic and financial security constitute non-traditional key domains among the twenty priority areas of the global vision of national security, and are also crucial factors in ensuring the stable development and long-term security of Macau and the country”. Tai Kin Ip aims to “pragmatically promote the development of adequate diversification of the economy, strengthening Macau’s global economic resilience and maintaining a high level of attention to various risks and challenges in the economic and financial domain”. Raymond Tam, Secretary for Transport and Public Works, said Macau must “cultivate an awareness of vigilance in times of peace, in order to consolidate the foundations of lasting stability and security”. In this sense, the government official understands that “Macau must always put the safeguarding of the sovereignty, security and development interests of the State first”, and in terms of Transport and Public Works he promises to “persist in the predominance of Executive power, firmly integrating the safeguarding of national security in all tasks”. Ao Ieong Seong, Commissioner against Corruption, believes that “the security and stability of the political environment and the good functioning of the system, with the predominance of the Executive branch, [guarantees that] the level of governance in the Macao SAR is increasingly higher”. The commissioner highlighted “last year’s successful holding of the elections for the 8th Legislative Assembly, reinforcing the implementation of the principle of ‘Macau governed by patriots’ and effectively ensuring the lasting stability of the Macao SAR”.

item.title: Flights | Direct connections between Macau and PLP defended
item.description: Representative Song Pek Kei yesterday defended the creation of direct air links between the territory and Portuguese-speaking countries, with the aim of “enriching the air network” of the territory. “It is important to launch incentive measures to encourage operators in the [airline] sector to explore more direct international routes, with priority being given to expanding the direct flight network with Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries,” said Song Pek Kei, in an intervention at the Legislative Assembly (AL). The Macau Civil Aviation Activity Law came into force this year, opening the door to the liberalization of the sector. Song Pek Kei stated that, with the entry into force of this legislation, the Government “must accelerate” the adjustment of the service structure and “make good use” of resources to develop more routes with stopovers and connections. “Taking the experiences of other regions as a reference, it is important to launch incentive measures to encourage operators in the sector to explore more direct international routes,” he added. Other requests Song Pek Kei is not the first deputy to propose to the Government the creation of new air routes that connect the Chinese region to Europe. In December, Ip Sio Kai also defended the establishment of a direct air link with Lisbon, to promote business between Portuguese-speaking countries and Europe. Ip suggested that the Government grant subsidies for the opening of this long-haul flight and launch promotions for accommodation, transport and cultural activities to attract tourists to Macau. In response to Ip Sio Kai in the hemicycle, the president of the Civil Aviation Authority, Pun Wa Kin, stated that the Government “attaches great importance” to the development of aviation, “in particular its role in promoting economic diversification”. “However, in commercial operations, airlines often consider market demand, operational costs, long-term benefits and the competitiveness of the route, before deciding to launch new flights”, declared Pun Wa Kin, to whom the Government Head of Transport and Public Works, Tam Vai Man, had handed over the prerogative of responding to the deputy. When Ip suggested that the Government could subsidize the route, Pun responded that this support “involves different sectoral policies” and that “the Macao SAR Government needs to analyze the issue comprehensively, from all aspects”.

item.title: Valentine's Day | Macau Orchestra brings special concert
item.description: This Saturday, the Macau Orchestra will take the stage at the Broadway Theater for a show that celebrates love and, more specifically, Valentine's Day. It is “Symphonic Circus – Film Melodies”, which features Tony Cheng-Te Yeh as conductor and a special performance by the group “Cirque de la Symphonie” The concert entitled “Symphonic Circus – Film Melodies” takes place this Saturday, starring the Macau Orchestra (OM), and taking place at the Broadway Theatre, in Cotai. In order to celebrate Valentine's Day, this show, presented from 8pm, not only features classical music, under the baton of maestro Tony Cheng-Te Yeh, but also features a special performance by “Cirque de la Symphonie”. According to an official note about the concert, this promises to be “a night full of fun in a show that integrates magic, clowning, mime, juggling, dancing, acrobatics and aerial performances with circus props of all shapes and sizes”. Regarding music, OM will perform “popular themes from ballet, opera and even Hollywood, crossing genres and spanning centuries”. According to the organization, “each number of this show promises to delight and inspire, alternating between demonstrations of strength and resistance, and moments of flexibility and lightness”. The concert is described as “one of OM’s most colorful performances this season”, featuring “a parade of wonders”. Melodies in March Meanwhile, another concert starring OM was also announced for March 3, but this time in the Ruins of São Paulo. It is “Unforgettable Melodies in the Ruins of São Paulo” which aims to “celebrate the Lantern Festival with the public”. On March 3rd there will be two sessions, one at 6pm and the other at 7pm, both with free entry. According to a note from the Cultural Institute (IC), which promotes the show, the baton will be in the hands of resident conductor Liao Yuan-Yu, presenting “a selection of festive pieces and popular Chinese works to celebrate the Lantern Festival with music aficionados”. The IC explains that each concert will last 30 minutes, and on the day of the show measures will be implemented to control the flow of people within the venue. When maximum capacity is reached, no more people will be allowed to enter. Viewers can also follow the live broadcast of the concerts through various online platforms.

item.title: AI | Bytedance launches new model capable of generating more realistic videos
item.description: Technological advances are multiplying at a breakneck speed. ByteDance's new artificial intelligence model presents itself as a turning point in the film and television sectors Chinese technology company ByteDance has attracted the attention of users and investors after launching an artificial intelligence model for video generation that analysts say “exceeds expectations in terms of realism”. The new application, called Seedance 2.0, was launched this weekend, and its capabilities have already resulted in significant rises in the stock market for companies, not only in the technology sector, but also in the entertainment industry, with some of them reaching the daily earnings limit in recent sessions. According to economic news portal Caixin, this model is capable of generating realistic images with fluid movements, also adding sounds that coincide with the images, which for the first time puts ByteDance in a position to compete with KlingAI, developed by the short video platform Kuaishou. Feng Ji, producer of the popular video game Black Myth: Wukong, described Seedance 2.0 as “the most powerful video generation model yet,” and predicted a major impact on reducing production costs for film and television, as well as other types of content. The official Seedance 2.0 portal states that the big difference compared to similar models is its ability to maintain the coherence of the characters in different scenes. New chapter According to analysts at Kaiyuan Securities, cited by the Bloomberg agency, this new model could mark a turning point in the use of AI in film and television: "The test results are impressive. It supports text, image, video and audio input, and has achieved significant progress in crucial capabilities." Feng also warned of the risks of the proliferation of fake videos generated by these types of services, which could lead to a crisis of trust: “Realistic fake videos will be available to everyone, and intellectual property and supervision systems will face unprecedented challenges.” "In the future, any video content that does not have an official and authorized backing – especially those with personal images and voices – may be fake. Please be sure to verify them through multiple channels to avoid being scammed," the producer wrote on social media. Seedance 2.0 did not reach the market in isolation, as its great local rival, the aforementioned KlingAI, launched its 3.0 version on the 4th, with intelligent framing and the ability to add new images and people to the original video as major attractions.

item.title: Zone A | Ten more cameras from the “Eyes in the Sky” system in operation
item.description: The first 10 cameras of the Macau video surveillance system, known as “Eyes in the Sky”, came into operation in Zone A of the New Landfills, in compliance with the order of the Secretary for Security, published yesterday in the Official Bulletin, which comes into force today. According to a statement also released yesterday by the Unitary Police Services (SPU), “in conjunction with the development plan for Zone A of the New Landfills, security authorities plan to install, in phases, 120 cameras in this area”. The first dozen cameras were installed in the peripheral areas of the Tong Seng, Tong Chong and Tong Kai Buildings, covering the main roads and pedestrian crossings, among other public spaces The authorities indicate that, currently, the “Eyes in the Sky” system has 1,711 cameras, and that in the first nine months of 2025, the system supported the investigation of 7,131 crimes, “involving cases of homicide, drug trafficking, robbery, theft, arson, possession of a prohibited weapon, harm to physical integrity, fraud and illegitimate appropriation of found property”. The SPU also added that the expansion of the video surveillance system aims to increase the capacity for security prevention and control, “with a view to preventing and combating criminal activities, providing scientific and technological support for Macau's security”.

item.title: Ana Cristina Alves
item.description: Ana Cristina Alves – Assistant Researcher and Coordinator of the Educational Service of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center When listening to the Lecture on the Year of the Horse by Professor Wang Suoying at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center regarding Chinese astrology and, specifically, the Fire Horse, which will inaugurate a new zodiacal period from February 17, 2026, I was able to recall some of the essential characteristics of the horse, transmitted by Chinese folk wisdom. Thus the horse begins to mythologically combine with the dragon in Dragon-Horse (龙马Lóngmǎ). This is an ideal combination, both on a mental and aesthetic level. From a spiritual point of view, the pair allows access to the organization of the world guided by intuitive wisdom, since it was on the back of this animal that the first legendary Chinese emperor Fuxi (伏羲) discovered the eight trigrams, fundamental for understanding the world. Let us remember them: the Creative Heaven (乾 Qián), the Receptive Earth (坤 Kūn), the abyssal Water (坎Kǎn), the clinging Fire (离 Lí), the awakening Thunder or Lightning (震 Zhèn), the gentle and penetrating Wind (巽 Xùn), the Joyful Lake (兑Duì) and the tranquil Mountain (艮 Gě) . These eight trigrams, with the qualities already mentioned, gave rise to the 64 hexagrams that make up the Classic of Changes, as I have already had the opportunity to mention, for example, in the text A Mulher na China (2007) or in the poetic work Visitações (2022). Through the composition of the trigrams into hexagrams, a world is exposed that poetically unfolds, depending on the intuitive and imaginative capabilities of each person, with precepts open to past, but also present and future existential experiences. Each person will be able to find what they are looking for at the same time as they create and recreate themselves with the help of the real elements of Heaven, Earth, Fire, Water and all others that they consider useful for their existential path, also traced with the help of the mind and, above all, the imagination. Still in its connection with the dragon in the proverbial expression “the Spirit of the Dragon-Horse” (龙马精神Lóngmǎ jīngshén) it represents the realization of an aesthetic ideal full of energy, beauty and power of transformation, just as these animals are for the Chinese. It starts, however, from a concrete floor and then flies. The land of popular wisdom tells us that the horse is a noble and loyal animal, which knows the path (老马识途Lǎomǎ-shítú), since experience is the mother of wisdom in it, but it is not just any experience: it is energetic, a good friend and loyal. This loyalty and energy could not be more noble, especially since since Chinese antiquity, equids have been the faithful companions of nobles. Therefore, the horse (马mǎ) also appears associated in language with nobility (侯hòu) and, through a game of homophonies, with the monkey (猴hóu), hence if in a painting the monkey appears on top of the horse, it means the possibility of receiving an honorific title, that is, of elevating the status. A horse can develop a lot of energy, with the most capable being those who travel a thousand miles (千里马Qiānlǐmǎ), whether equine or human, because there are also people overflowing with capacity and energy, like these animals, with those who had the blessing of being born under the good auspices of the Horse being in a more favorable position to cultivate enthusiasm and dynamism. This year of Fire. The suggestion is to return to the Classic of Changes (易经Yì jīng), to try to understand what the Fire hexagram has to offer, which is adherent and brilliant, composed of two trigrams of Fire (离下、离上 Lí Xià, Li Shàng), therefore the representation of the element in a pure state, thus enabling the understanding of the fundamental characteristics of the Fire Horse that enters in the middle of February. In Richard Wilhelm's interpretation, translated into English by Cary F. Baynes (1989, 118-121), we read that fire is dependent, it is always conditioned to something or someone else, for example to the combustion of Wood, only in this way can it be so alive and bright, and the more it burns, the more it rises from the earth towards the sky. In the judgment of the lines it is informed that if you adhere with perseverance like a cow, you will be guaranteed success (離，利貞，亨。畜牝牛，吉。2) (Zhang, 1995,131). Regarding his image, he appears to illuminate and doubly so, since when he shines he does so for himself and for others (《象》明兩作，離；大人以繼明，照於四方) (Zhang, 1995,135)., just as the sun shines and warms the earth throughout the day. Being a conditioned element, like all others, in a world of interdependence, everything that does not burn positively and for good must be abandoned, just like the ancient Chinese leaders at the end of the dynasties who stopped being model and became capricious and destructive. The positive energy of the Fire Horse is like a beneficent sun that inspires everyone. If you ask the greatest of all Chinese poets, Li Bai (701-762), here in the translation by António Graça de Abreu, in One Hundred Poems of Li Bai 李白诗一百首 what virtues he associates with the horse, we read in response, for example, in “Your bay horse 君马黄” which is friendship and life experience, with its highs and low, but always worthy of being lived in the company of good friends: 君马黄，我马白。 马色虽不同，人心本无隔。 共作游治盘，双行洛阳陌。 长剑既照曜，高冠何赤3赫。 各有千金裘，俱为五侯客。 猛虎落陷阱，壮士时屈厄。 Article Your horse is bay my horse is white. Different color of horses, similar to the hearts of friends. Through the streets of Luoyang we know happy days, sword at waist, tall hats, valuable fur coats. guests of five marquises. Even tigers fall into the trap. Today strong and brave, Tomorrow subject to the misadventures of luck. If such a day happens, Help from a friend. (Abreu, 2021, 174) In a leap forward to contemporary times, we will find in the poet Yao Feng (1958-), in Palavras Cansadas da Gramática (2014) the same traditional reading and an interesting identification with the horse, in “Cavalo Velho”, preserving the idea of friendship that extends throughout the Chinese centuries, but in an inverted presentation of the free condition of the animal, which appears, as happens mutatis mutandis to so many people, sad and imprisoned, unnaturally, in a cart, that is, a social condition, translated into the provision of services to others: Accustomed to the coachman, to passers-by, to cars Forgotten what it's like to gallop Dirty, sagging skin, gloomy as the end of the day Ironed hulls make the trail on the flat Even longer Sitting in a noisy village tavern I saw a horse bent under the weight of the cart Pull up and I would like To tell him in his language: Come in here, old friend, I'll buy you a drink! (Yao, 2014, 122) It is certainly against the essential nature of equids to allow themselves to be imprisoned. They, who love to run freely across the prairies and steppes, through the mountains and valleys, can be domesticated by friendship, suffering and participating in the place of the social order that humans have destined for them. And like people, they also age, losing much of the vigor and energy they were born with, which is reflected in skin that loses its shine and sags. But while they are in the strength of life, and if they are lucky enough to remain free, there is no greater dynamism than theirs. To conclude, my poetic tribute to the Year of the Horse that gallops towards us brimming with strength, enthusiasm and joy: Fire Horse Beautiful, fast, dreamy, Run against the pain, Growing in wind or breeze in the wake of flowers, They dancing in the passage, of paws loaded with earth and heat. Beautiful, fast, dreamy, carry the monkey, And on the back the dragon, they call it the Spirit of the Dragon Horse. 龙马精神 Horse-Dragon Spirit, In a year that brings shine and the light like heralds, sounding strong and loud. item.title: Today Macau
item.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said yesterday that Moscow will continue to comply with the limits imposed on its nuclear arsenal, despite the recent end of the New START treaty, as long as the United States does the same. These restrictions “will remain in force, but only as long as the United States does not exceed the limits stipulated” in the treaty, Lavrov said in an intervention made yesterday in the Russian parliament. Moscow “will act in a responsible and considered manner, based on an analysis of US military policy (…) and an analysis of the general strategic situation”, he added. Russia and the United States have by far the largest nuclear arsenals in the world, but since the New START Treaty expired earlier this month, there is no nuclear disarmament agreement linking the two powers. The treaty, signed in 2010 between Russia and the United States, limited the number of nuclear missile launchers to intercontinental distances. It expired on February 5th, as US President Donald Trump did not respond to Moscow's proposal to extend it.

item.title: Paulo Maia and Carmo
item.description: Jiang Shinian, also known as Shennong, the «Divine Farmer», patron saint of practitioners of traditional medicine (zhongyi), is also known as Yandi, the «emperor of flames» and is therefore able to control the «flaming wind», the excess heat that causes symptoms such as tremors, confusion or sudden fever. In religious practice, this “fire in the wind” is understood as the smoke that results from the burning of incense or papers that carry prayers, offerings or messages to the gods, ancestors or spirits up to the heavens. This fire, represented by the color red, is associated, among others, with immortality, positive energy forces or protection against evil. Shades of the color red were notoriously adopted by the emperors of the Ming dynasty who had Zhu, “vermilion or cinnabar” as their family name. One of the most publicly manifest examples was painting the walls of the “Forbidden Imperial City”, Zijincheng, purple, as a form of protection for the occupants inside, or giving the clothing of literate officials the color of cinnabar. When the dynasty fell and for many literati it became intolerable to obey the new emperors, some adopted the most diverse and subtle strategies of resistance. A scholar from the North who, in the plurality of his knowledge and vocations, came to use more than thirty names of brush, created for himself the name Zhuyi daoren, the «Daoist dressed in cinnabar» as if by using this protective color, he only recognized his own body as the only border or wall. In ordinary life, his name was Fu Shan (1607-1684), born in Yangqu, Shanxi, and from his refusal to serve his new masters, which harmed his day-to-day life, countless talents emerged, still celebrated today in two gardens in the city of Taiyuan, the provincial capital. And although all the literati who knew him recognized his qualities as a calligrapher, painter or poet, those closest to him saw him as a practitioner of traditional medicine, in particular as an expert on women's illnesses. Fu Shan preferred his handwriting to be “rough, not skillful; ugly, not seductive; deformed, not thin; spontaneous, not premeditated». And just like in paintings, he liked long vertical formats, as can be seen in a couplet in the Smithonian (ink on paper, 226 x 45.5 cm) where, reflecting his dual concern with the spirit and the body, he wrote: «If the spirit is calm, the mind naturally reaches the distance; The more relaxed your body is, the more of life you will be able to enjoy». He is credited with creating an “eight treasure soup”, made with eight ingredients that restored the most weakened. And yet, when he was forced to go to court in Beijing for the ritual of obedience to the new dynasty, he threw himself to the ground, suffering an incapacitating illness. Walking along the riverbank, enjoying the flowers, 6 (out of 7): Access to Huangsi's in-laws' house it is full of flowers everywhere, There are a thousand, ten thousand flowers pressing the branches, so full, bent. Repeatedly invite the butterflies to stay constantly dancing, I listen to orioles: how they are tuned in your delicate chirp. Du Fu (712-770)
